metadata.title: CVE-2015-1207 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
Double-free vulnerability in libavformat/mov.c in FFMPEG in Google Chrome41.0.2251.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memorycorruption and crash) via a crafted .m4a file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1207` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu0.16.04.1306
chromium-browser-l10n - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu0.16.04.1306
chromium-chromedriver - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu0.16.04.1306
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu0.16.04.1306
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu0.16.04.1306
No subscription required

ffmpeg - 2.6
libav-tools-links - 2.6
libavcodec-extra - 2.6
libavcodec-ffmpeg-extra56 - 2.6
libavcodec-ffmpeg56 - 2.6
libavdevice-ffmpeg56 - 2.6
libavfilter-ffmpeg5 - 2.6
libavformat-ffmpeg56 - 2.6
libavresample-ffmpeg2 - 2.6
libavutil-ffmpeg54 - 2.6
libpostproc-ffmpeg53 - 2.6
libswresample-ffmpeg1 - 2.6
libswscale-ffmpeg3 - 2.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu0.16.04.1306').
ffmpeg package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.6').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
